subject: Problems with New JUnit 3.6 and HTTPUnit
msgSnippet: Using the new JUnit 3.6, along with the latest HTTPUnit 1.2.3 and JTidy (20 Dec 2000), we get the following exception when trying to run some servlet unit
messageBody:
Using the new JUnit 3.6, along with the latest HTTPUnit 1.2.3
and JTidy (20 Dec 2000), we get the following exception when
trying to run some servlet unit tests:

java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access field
org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl._parseHead from class org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl$ParseHTML
at org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl$ParseHTML.parse(ParserImpl.java)
at org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl.parseDocument(ParserImpl.java)
at org.w3c.tidy.Tidy.parse(Tidy.java)
at org.w3c.tidy.Tidy.parseDOM(Tidy.java)
at com.meterware.httpunit.ReceivedPage.getDOM(ReceivedPage.java:62)
at com.meterware.httpunit.ReceivedPage.<init>(ReceivedPage.java:44)
at com.meterware.httpunit.WebResponse.getReceivedPage(WebResponse.java:431)
at com.meterware.httpunit.WebResponse.getFrames(WebResponse.java:414)
at com.meterware.httpunit.WebResponse.getFrameNames(WebResponse.java:160)
at com.meterware.httpunit.WebClient.updateFrames(WebClient.java:269)
at com.meterware.httpunit.WebClient.getResponse(WebClient.java:73)
at com.meterware.httpunit.WebClient.getResponse(WebClient.java:71)
at
test.com.escrow.gtc.BoaConfirmServletTest.testSellerAgrees(BoaConfirmServlet
Test.java:32)

We haven't had a chance to debug this yet, but it seems some
sort of incompatibility was introduced in Junit 3.6. JUnit
3.5 works fine.

Any ideas as to what might be going on?

-Paul
